alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 29 at 9:43AM CDT until November 01 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Sunday was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening and continue falling to 11.6 feet Sunday, November 05. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 04/23/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM CDT.
